Standard_Text: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts, including using adjectives and adverbs to describe (e.g., When other kids are happy that makes me happy).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Distinguish shades of meaning among closely related verbs (e.g., toss, throw, hurl) and closely related adjectives (e.g., thin, slender, skinny, scrawny).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., describe foods that are spicy or juicy).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate understanding of word relationships and nuances in word meanings.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use glossaries and beginning dictionaries, both print and digital, to determine or clarify the meaning of words and phrases in all content areas.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use knowledge of the meaning of individual words to predict the meaning of compound words (e.g., birdhouse, lighthouse, housefly; bookshelf, notebook, bookmark).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use a known root word as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root (e.g., addition, additional).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Determine the meaning of the new word formed when a known prefix is added to a known word (e.g., happy/unhappy, tell/retell).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use sentence-level context as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 2 reading and content, choosing flexibly from an array of strategies.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Vocabulary Acquisition and Use
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Compare formal and informal uses of English.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Knowledge of Language
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Consult reference materials, including beginning dictionaries, as needed to check and correct spellings.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Generalize learned spelling patterns when writing words (e.g., cage → badge; boy → boil).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use an apostrophe to form contractions and frequently occurring possessives.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use commas in greetings and closings of letters.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Capitalize holidays, product names, and geographic names.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Create readable documents with legible print.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Produce, expand, and rearrange complete simple and compound sentences (e.g., The boy watched the movie; The little boy watched the movie; The action movie was watched by the little boy).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use adjectives and adverbs, and choose between them depending on what is to be modified.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Form and use the past tense of frequently occurring irregular verbs (e.g., sat, hid, told).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use reflexive pronouns (e.g., myself, ourselves).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Form and use frequently occurring irregular plural nouns (e.g., feet, children, teeth, mice, fish).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use collective nouns (e.g., group).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Conventions of Standard English
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Language Standards
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Vocabulary Acquisition and Use
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Knowledge of Language
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Conventions of Standard English
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Language
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Produce complete sentences when appropriate to task and situation in order to provide requested detail or clarification.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Create audio recordings of stories or poems; add drawings or other visual displays to stories or recounts of experiences when appropriate to clarify ideas, thoughts, and feelings.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Plan and deliver a narrative presentation that: recounts a well-elaborated event, includes details, reflects a logical sequence, and provides a conclusion.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Tell a story or recount an experience with appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive details, speaking audibly in coherent sentences.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Presentation of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Ask and answer questions about what a speaker says in order to clarify comprehension, gather additional information, or deepen understanding of a topic or issue.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Give and follow three- and four-step oral directions.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Recount or describe key ideas or details from a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Ask for clarification and further explanation as needed about the topics and texts under discussion.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Build on others' talk in conversations by linking their comments to the remarks of others.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., gaining the floor in respectful ways, listening to others with care, speaking one at a time about the topics and texts under discussion).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about grade 2 topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Comprehension and Collaboration
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Speaking and Listening Standards
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Presentation of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Comprehension and Collaboration
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Speaking and Listening
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Range of Writing
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: (Begins in grade 4)
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., read a number of books on a single topic to produce a report; record science observations).
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: With guidance and support from adults, use a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: With guidance and support from adults and peers, focus on a topic and strengthen writing as needed by revising and editing.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: With guidance and support from adults, produce writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task and purpose. (Grade-specific expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above.)
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: (Begins in grade 2)
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Production and Distribution of Writing
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Write narratives in which they recount a well-elaborated event or short sequence of events, include details to describe actions, thoughts, and feelings, use temporal words to signal event order, and provide a sense of closure.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Write informative/explanatory texts in which they introduce a topic, use facts and definitions to develop points, and provide a concluding statement or section.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Write opinion pieces in which they introduce the topic or book they are writing about, state an opinion, supply reasons that support the opinion, use linking words (e.g., because, and, also) to connect opinion and reasons, and provide a concluding statement or section.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Text Types and Purposes
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Writing Standards
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Range of Writing
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Research to Build and Present Knowledge
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Production and Distribution of Writing
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details, and well-structured event sequences.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Text Types and Purposes
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: College and Career Readiness Anchor Standards for Writing
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Read on-level text orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Read on-level text with purpose and understanding.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Fluency
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Recognize and read grade-appropriate irregularly spelled words.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify words with inconsistent but common spelling-sound correspondences.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Decode words with common prefixes and suffixes.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Decode regularly spelled two-syllable words with long vowels.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Know spelling-sound correspondences for additional common vowel teams.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Distinguish long and short vowels when reading regularly spelled one-syllable words.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words both in isolation and in text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Phonics and Word Recognition
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Reading Standards: Foundational Skills
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: By the end of year, read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and technical texts, in the grades 2—3 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Compare and contrast the most important points presented by two texts on the same topic.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Describe how reasons support specific points the author makes in a text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Explain how specific images (e.g., a diagram showing how a machine works) contribute to and clarify a text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify the main purpose of a text, including what the author wants to answer, explain, or describe.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Know and use various text features (e.g., captions, bold print, subheadings, glossaries, indexes, electronic menus, icons) to locate key facts or information in a text efficiently.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Determine the meaning of words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 2 topic or subject area.(See grade 2 Language standards 4–6 for additional expectations.)
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Craft and Structure
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Describe the connection between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in technical procedures in a text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Identify the main topic of a multiparagraph text as well as the focus of specific paragraphs within the text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Ask and answer such questions as who, what, where, when, why, and how to demonstrate understanding of key details in a text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Key Ideas and Details
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Reading Standards for Informational Text
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: By the end of the year, read and comprehend literature, including stories and poetry, in the grades 2—3 text complexity band proficiently, with scaffolding as needed at the high end of the range.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Compare and contrast two or more versions of the same story (e.g., Cinderella stories) by different authors or from different cultures.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: (Not applicable to literature)
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Use information gained from the illustrations and words in a print or digital text to demonstrate understanding of its characters, setting, or plot.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Acknowledge differences in the points of view of characters, including by speaking in a different voice for each character when reading dialogue aloud.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Describe the overall structure of a story, including describing how the beginning introduces the story and the ending concludes the action.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Describe how words and phrases (e.g., regular beats, alliteration, rhymes, repeated lines) supply rhythm and meaning in a story, poem, or song.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Craft and Structure
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Describe how characters in a story respond to major events and challenges.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Recount stories, including fables and folktales from diverse cultures, and determine their central message, lesson, or moral.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Ask and answer such questions as who, what, where, when, why, and how to demonstrate understanding of key details in a text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Key Ideas and Details
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Reading Standards for Literature
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Integration of Knowledge and Ideas
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Craft and Structure
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)

Standard_Text: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
Subject: English Language Arts & Literacy (2010-)
